result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: scanned and destroyed

Defendant Donald L Counter in court with attorney Katie Bricco.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charges are dismissed and read into 16CF4.  Calendar call scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-11-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Donald L Counter in court with attorney Katie Bricco and Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner advises the Court the State is requesting an adjournment of the trial and that the misdemeanor cases tag along with 16CF4.  Attorney Bricco requests that all files be scheduled for plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  The Court adjourns the trial on 15CM1380.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

From State dated 2/19/16 requesting trial be adjourned.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian on 2/23/16.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 3/3/16 at 8:30 a.m. and 3/15/16 at 8:15 a.m.
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-15-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 03-03-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Donald L Counter in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Weitzner requests an adjournment as the Defendant has obtained new charges.  The Court grants the adjournment of the trial. The Court resets the matter for trial.
From Atty Weitzner dated 1/20/16 requesting an adjournment of court hearing on 1/20/16.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Donald L Counter did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Weitzner has received discovery and is planning to request additional discovery from the State.   The Court sets the matter for trial on 15CM1380, this case to tag along.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Donald L Counter in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Weitzner requests the matter be set for a further proceding in a few weeks.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Donald L Counter in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests another date.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation or seek another counsel. Court will give another date in 3 weeks.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business in Big Bend listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Donald L Counter in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Defendant to seek counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
